'SHARE' is a "highly regarded New York City peer support" organization of women
affected by breast or ovarian cancer. http://www.medicinenet.com/script/ma-
in/art.asp?articlekey=51256&page=2 SHARE is a professionally managed
volunteer organization. Trained volunteers and staff who are breast or ovarian
cancer survivors operate telephone hotlines in English, Spanish and ten other
languages, lead support groups, and offer an array of educational services in 18
sites and in every borough of New York City. http://health.msn.com/health-topics/breast-
cancer/articlepage.aspx?cp-
documentid=100107456 http://www.nypost.com/p/lifestyle/health/help_is-
_nearby_if_cancer_strikes_KsB7GLXmrW1LvPDheYzTdN SHARE does not charge for
any of its services, and has been praised for "their extensive outreach programs
to underserved communities in New York City." Mayer,Musa Advanced Breast
Cancer: A Guide to Living with Metastatic Disease, 2nd Edition O'Reilly &
Associates, Inc., 1998.
http://oreilly.com/medical/breastcancer/news/general.html The organization
cooperates with several major hospitals in the New York City area. http://nyp.org/services/oncology/columbia-breast-
center.html
